column4: Hi.  I'm trying to get my wireless connection up, on Ubuntu 10.04.  I do see a wlan0 device, but it does not say CLAIMED or UNCLAIMED or ENABLED or DISABLED, which is what https://help.ubuntu.com/10.04/internet/C/troubleshooting-wireless.html said to check.
how do I troubleshoot my wireless connection?
when I click on the little double arrows icon on my task bar and the networks menu pops up, under Wireless Networks it says "disconnected".  How do I connect?
my wireless interface driver is driver=b43-pci-bridge
how do I connect to a wireless network?
how do I get into NetworkManager, please?
type nm-connection-editor into your terminal and see if anything pops up
nm-connection-editor window popped up, thanks.  how do i get the list of available networks?  (it doesn't show any)   (I guess it won't if "iwlist wlan0 scan" does not return any, hey?)
you can create one but if your nm-applet is working and wlan0 is up and running it usually creates a profile for you named auto
what does sudo ifconfig wlan0 up do?
ifconfig wlan0 shows it is UP
I don't see any available networks.  :(   I know there are networks available.
iwlist scanning should reveal some networks
I know for sure there are networks in range
